channel.title: Fence Fixing
channel.description: I am trying to add new things to my server and fix things. And one major thing keeps annoying me while I am trying to do this (It is also a thing that I need to fix). It is the fences. It puts like the antler things instead of a fence. Is there anyway to fix this?

item.title: Fence Fixing
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

The cache files are in that folder, replace them with a clean one (no damage),then reload the models, or preload them.

Also moving to client help as it’s not a server related issue.

Read full topic

item.title: Fence Fixing
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

I really don’t know which ones are my cache files. When I click “cache” it takes me to a folder named “.file_store_32”. Do I replace that are the files in that folder?

Read full topic

item.title: Fence Fixing
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote="_, post:6, topic:289213"][quote author=Newty link=topic=382310.msg2871603#msg2871603 date=1247797093]

Yes, there is a way.

Want to at least point him in the right direction, if not then don’t post.

It’s the cache that you are using, just use a different client.
[/quote]

Is there anyway to fix this?

Yes, there is a way.

I was answering the question at hand.[/quote]

Yes, albeit a fucking dumb answer, if you actually knew the answer you would have posted it instead of leaving him a comment that makes you appear smart.

b b0yz 4:

Ok, I found the Cache file on my server and when I click it it takes me to a file named “.file_store_32”. Do I delete that folder and put my new cache in?

Replace all the old cache files with all of your new cache files.

Read full topic

item.title: Fence Fixing
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

b b0yz 4:

Well I am using the Client that is meant to go with my server. It is a Delta based server.

Replace the cache with a fixed cache then, you can find a fixed cache (partially I think) in the download section.

Read full topic
